Hi Greg,

The plugin uses JunitFactory's test runner, which generates the  
coverage information. When it gets installed, there
is a new context menu item in the Run menu, to Run as Agitar Test.

Can you try running your tests with that to see if you have the  
NoClassDefFound errors? The classloader does runtime
instrumentation, so if you have another runner that also does runtime  
bytecode manipulation they might be conflicting.

Thanks,
Bob

http://www.junitfactory.com/
See testing in action, on your own code.



On Nov 6, 2007, at 8:45 PM, Greg Irvine wrote:

> Hi Alberto.
>
> I've downloaded the update site and given it a whirl.
>
> The problem I'm facing is all tests fail with  
> NoClassDefFoundError(s) during the run when
> triggered from Run Crap4J, which doesn't occur if I Run As JUnit Test.
>
> It still reports a CRAP result, etc, which is interesting.
>
> Any ideas?
>
> Cheers.
>
> Greg
>
